summary: This is a transcript of FBI Special Agent I. testifying before a federal grand jury in West Palm Beach regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The agent details the origins of the case from the Palm Beach Police Department, the interstate travel nexus, the roles of Epstein's assistants in scheduling underage girls for sexual massages, and the extensive subpoenas issued for financial records, flight manifests, and other evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Investment advisor with multiple residences, accused of engaging in sexual activity with underage females who were paid for massages at his Palm Beach home.

events.title: Palm Beach Police Investigation Initiated
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department initiated an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involving multiple underage females visiting his residence for sexual massages.

events.title: FBI Investigation Opened
events.description: The FBI opened its own investigation into Epstein, focusing on the underage minors and the interstate nexus, after the case was presented by Palm Beach PD.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: FBI Special Agent I. testifies before the federal grand jury in West Palm Beach, detailing the investigation, evidence collected, and roles of Epstein's associates.

events.title: Period of Focused Activity
events.description: The FBI investigation focused on 2004-2005, during which Epstein took approximately 60 trips to Palm Beach and his assistants scheduled underage girls for massages. Evidence suggests activity may have started earlier, in 2003.

events.title: Recruitment Chain Established
events.description: Epstein instructed girls who came for massages to bring other girls, paying them $200 for recruiting. This created a chain of victims, with assistants collecting phone numbers of new girls.

locations: 701 Clematis Street, West Palm Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida (Grand Jury location)
Palm Beach, Florida (Location of Epstein's part-time residence)
Virgin Islands (Location of Epstein's primary residence/island)
New York (Location of Epstein's office and home)
keyFacts: The FBI investigation identified that the majority of girls involved with Epstein were underage, with victims aged 14 to 17.
Epstein's personal assistants, notably , were key facilitators, using cell phones to schedule underage girls for appointments at his Palm Beach home.
The investigation established an interstate nexus through Epstein's use of private aircraft (two planes and a helicopter) for approximately 60 trips to Palm Beach in 2004-2005.

A wide range of subpoenas were issued, including to banks, Epstein's businesses (Hyperion Air, Inc., JEGE, Inc.), pilots, property managers, schools, and a hospital (regarding a baby possibly fathered by Epstein).
The recruitment method involved Epstein paying girls $200-$400 for massages and an additional $200 for bringing new girls, creating a chain of victims.
